title: Anniversary gifts bugged?
body: Hi! I've logged into league this morning to claim the daily gift for league's 10th anniversary and i cant seem to be able to collect it yet. Has it not started yet? I did play a game today too.

replies.body: The daily mission spawns at 13:00 PDT which is 21:00 for EUW or 22:00 for EUNE.

Finally someone who can explain it in a normal fking way
In my country we dont use AM or PM or any of the BST PDT CEST 
it does nothing but cause confusion.
21:00 is at least something all people fking know.

The 12-hour clock is a time convention in which the 24 hours of the day are divided into two periods: a.m. (from Latin **ante meridiem**, translates to, **"before midday"**) and p.m. (from Latin **post meridiem** translates to, **"after midday"**). This doesn't have anything to do with timezones.

From 00:00 to 11:59 AM is a 12-hour AM (before midday) period and 12:00 to 23:59 is the 12-hour PM (after midday) period. Of course it's not a mistake to just use the 24-hour period clock if that's easier for you. Analog clocks (wrist watches, wall clocks, etc.) usually tell time in 12-hour periods too.

Timezones are different.
Timezones divide the whole globe in segments, _**theoretically**_ in 24 parts (1 hour per timezone). But in reality, there are timezones that are 30 or 45 minutes apart so there's more than 24 but we don't need to be concerned about that.

**PDT** is the timezone in which Riot is situated at, which means **Pacific Daylight Time**.
Timezones are oriented around **UTC** which stands for **Coordianted Universal Time**.
Timezones are also written like this "PDT (UTC -7)" which means "from UTC, PDT timezone is seven hours behind".

My country is in the CEST (UTC +2) timezone (Central European Summer Time) which means that, combining it with PDT (UTC -7), Riot's 7 hours behind but we're 2 hours ahead of UTC.
**In total, CEST is 9 hours ahead of PDT.**
---

Riot does convert their time in your local client's time but for this announcement, it just says "begins in 17/10" without a specific time so many people just expected to log in at exact date and start getting the rewards.

> BST PDT CEST
it does nothing but cause confusion.
